intro: Alphonsea isthmicola, commonly known as the Isthmian alphonsea, is a species of flowering plant native to the tropical regions of Central America and the Caribbean. It belongs to the family Anacardiaceae, which includes other well-known plants such as the cashew and mango. The plant is characterized by its compound leaves and small, fragrant flowers that typically bloom in clusters. It produces small, fleshy fruits that are edible and often consumed by local wildlife. Due to its limited distribution, Alphonsea isthmicola is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
